required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of Interscalene Block and Suprascapular With Axillary Block
clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of Analgesic Effectiveness of Ultrasound Guided Interscalene Block Versus Suprascapular With Axillary Block in Shoulder Arthroplasties

brief_summary.textblock: In this study, the investigators are going to compare the analgesia effectiveness of interscalane block and suprascapular with axillary block in shoulder arthroplasties

detailed_description.textblock:
In the preoperative period, the participants will be taken to the block room. The participants will be monitored, standard sedation will be applied.
The first group will be get interscalene block. The second group will be get suprascapular and axillary block. The third group patient will be get no block. Afterwards, the participants will be operated under general anesthesia. A patient-controlled analgesia device will be attached to each group of participants and their postoperative follow-up will be made.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Study group - Study group- Control group

primary_outcome.description: VAS (visual analog scale) (0: no pain, 10: the worst pain imaginable)

other_outcome.description: 5-point Likert scale: very satisfied (= 5), relatively satisfied (= 4), fairly satisfied (= 3), relatively dissatisfied (= 2) and very dissatisfied (= 1)

other_outcome.time_frame: Will be done 3 times 1- on pre-operative hospitalization 2- in the hospital after surgery 3- in the 1st month follow-up after surgery
other_outcome.description: 0-9: indicates minimal depression 10-18: indicates mild depression 19-29: indicates moderate depression 30-63: indicates severe depression.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Study group: interscalene block + IV PCA
arm_group.description: preop usg guided interscalene block and IV PCA

arm_group.arm_group_label: Study group: suprascapular block + axillary block + IV PCA
arm_group.description: preop usg guided suprascapular block + axillary block and IV PCA

intervention.arm_group_label: Study group: interscalene block + IV PCA
Study group: suprascapular block + axillary block + IV PCA

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- accepting the study protocol,
- age older than 18 years and younger than 90 years,
- undergoing shoulder arthroplasty surgery
- the American Society of Anesthesiologist (ASA) physical status of I-II-III-IV
Exclusion Criteria:
- severe respiratory distress
- patients with local anesthetic allergy
- contralateral hemidiaphragmatic parrhesia
- recurrent laryngeal nerve palsy
- infection at the injection site
- coagulation disorder

overall_official.affiliation: Istanbul Unıversity, Istanbul Faculty of Medicine, Anesthesiology
